title: DANA en Mallorca: retrasos de una hora en el aeropuerto de Palma por el mal tiempo
text:
DANA en Mallorca: retrasos de una hora en el aeropuerto de Palma por el mal tiempo
Los aeropuertos de Baleares prevÃ©n operar este viernes, DÃ­a de Todos los Santos, 690 vuelos
La DGT pide evitar los desplazamientos por carretera en el archipiÃ©lago
El aeropuerto de Son Sant Joan, en Palma, estÃ¡ sufriendo este viernes retrasos generalizados, tanto en salidas como en llegadas, como consecuencia del mal tiempo derivado de la DANA que ya estÃ¡ afectando a Baleares. SegÃºn la informaciÃ³n que ha facilitado Aena, los retrasos son de media de unos 60 minutos.
Los aeropuertos del archipiÃ©lago prevÃ©n operar este viernes, dÃ­a de Todos los Santos, un total de 690 vuelos y mÃ¡s de 3.000 en todo el puente. En concreto, el aeropuerto de Palma serÃ¡ el que registrarÃ¡ mÃ¡s movimientos, con un total de 2.217 vuelos durante estos cuatro dÃ­as. Por otro lado, el de Ibiza operarÃ¡ 610 vuelos, mientras que el de Menorca, 235 vuelos.
Este viernes, estÃ¡ previsto que Palma registre 522 movimientos, Ibiza, 120 y Menorca, 48, aunque muchos de ellos se verÃ¡n afectados por las condiciones meteorolÃ³gicas adversas.

Hay que recordar que la Agencia Estatal de MeteorologÃ­a ha extendido el aviso naranja por fuertes lluvias que pueden dejar acumulaciones de 50 litros por metro cuadrado en una hora y de 120 litros en pocas horas al conjunto del archipiÃ©lago.
En el caso de Ibiza y Formentera, se espera que la alerta se desactive a las 19.59 horas de este viernes, mientras que en Mallorca y Menorca estarÃ¡ vigente hasta primera hora de este sÃ¡bado.
En Mallorca, la alerta se ha activado a las 10.00 horas mientras que en Menorca se activarÃ¡ mÃ¡s tarde, a las 16.00 horas. En ambos casos estarÃ¡ vigente hasta primera hora del sÃ¡bado. En el caso de Ibiza y Formentera, la alerta era inicialmente amarilla pero se ha elevado a naranja.

Ante este escenario, el Servicio de Emergencias 112 mantiene activado el Ãndice de Gravedad 1 (IG1) del Plan Meteobal por lluvias y tormentas en todo el archipiÃ©lago. Emergencias espera este viernes una Â«jornada complicadaÂ» por lo que ha pedido mÃ¡xima precauciÃ³n a la poblaciÃ³n.
La DGT pide evitar los desplazamientos por carretera
La DirecciÃ³n General de TrÃ¡fico (DGT) ha pedido este viernes evitar los desplazamientos por carretera en Baleares y otros puntos de EspaÃ±a afectados por la DANA. En el archipiÃ©lago, por su parte, Emergencias ha indicado que en caso de tener que circular, se haga moderando la velocidad y aumentando la distancia de seguridad.
Recomiendan hacerlo siempre por autopistas y carreteras principales. En caso de baja visibilidad, insisten en que hay detener el vehÃ­culo y seÃ±alizar su posiciÃ³n.
Si el coche comienza a flotar y es arrastrado, hay que salir de forma inmediata, abandonar el vehÃ­culo dirigirse a zonas mÃ¡s altas en caso de que el coche quede inmovilizado. Recuerdan la necesidad de llevar el telÃ©fono mÃ³vil cargado y con suficiente combustible en el vehÃ­culo.

title: Pior Ã© impossÃ­vel - Expresso
text: Pior Ã© impossÃ­vel As estruturas de governaÃ§Ã£o parecem tomadas por uma estranha paralisia que impede a efetividade das medidas que a gravidade dos problemas exigem As estruturas de governaÃ§Ã£o parecem tomadas por uma estranha paralisia que impede a efetividade das medidas que a gravidade dos problemas exigem Na semana em que se celebrou o Dia Mundial do Ambiente convÃ©m relembrar o estudo sobre a prospetiva das alteraÃ§Ãµes climÃ¡ticas em Portugal apresentado em maio e que, estranhamente, foi tÃ£o pouco anunciado que quase passou desapercebido. Designado Roteiro Nacional para a AdaptaÃ§Ã£o 2100 (RNA 2100), foi financiado pelos EEAGrants e encomendado pela AgÃªncia Portuguesa do Ambiente (APA) Ã  mais credenciada equipa cientÃ­fica do paÃ­s nesta matÃ©ria, envolvendo 30 investigadores da Faculdade de CiÃªncias da Universidade de Lisboa, e ainda o IPMA (Instituto PortuguÃªs do Mar e Atmosfera), a DGT (DireÃ§Ã£o-Geral do TerritÃ³rio) e o Banco de Portugal. author: Guardian Nigeria
title: Ukraine's soldiers mark Easter on the front line | The Guardian Nigeria News - Nigeria and World News World â€”
text: In a small house near the front line, the location a closely guarded secret, around 40 Ukrainian soldiers gathered for a copious breakfast to celebrate the Orthodox Easter. Gathered in a canteen, where the windows were blacked out with tarpaulins, the men of the 24th motorised brigade lined up in front of the chaplain. Under the harsh light of the lightbulb, the faces appeared tired after more than two years of harrowing warfare. Singing, prayers, blessing: the service lasted nearly an hour before the soldiers sat down to a breakfast of chicken, mashed potato, cakes and sodas. â€œIn the context of the day-to-day military work, this is a spiritual relief, a spiritual uplifting,â€ said one soldier, 49-year-old Igor Kotsko. â€œIt also gives you a lot of strength. To keep your morale up, to keep fighting the enemy,â€ he added. Rostyslav Vysochan, the 39-year-old military chaplain, shared the soldiersâ€™ meal, seated beside them. â€œIn war, life and death are so close,â€ he said. â€œAnd yet you have to see and feel the inner strength, which you can only get from the spirit.â€ The men were celebrating Easter at a time when Russian forces have been making frontline gains because of the lack of weapons and ammunitions on the Ukrainian side. Asked what the troops needed most badly, Vysochan replied: â€œAmmunition and God.â€ â€œYou need ammunition, good weapons, and you also need to have a strong inner resilience,â€ he added. â€œItâ€™s psychology, and you also need to have spiritual power. So you need both.â€ â€˜More death than Godâ€™ Just a few dozen kilometres away to the south, a small village next to the front line serves as the base for the 59th mechanised brigade. This time, it is a visiting chaplain who comes by to celebrate Easter with a handful of the unitâ€™s soldiers gathered in front of a house. â€œItâ€™s a chance for my guys to relax, those who are here,â€ said Mykola Panyshenko, the groupâ€™s 45-year-old commander. â€œFor whether youâ€™re in the trenches or here, you have to get your job done at all times.â€ Panyshenko, who has led the brigade, which has been in position here since November 2022, did not join his men for the service. â€œYou know, if there was a lot of God here, there wouldnâ€™t be so many deaths,â€ he said. â€œAnd there are a lot of deaths here. There is a lot of pain and suffering. â€œI understand that God protects Ukraine, because Ukraine is still holding on. The whole world is helping Ukraine. But here, at the front, in these trenches, there is certainly a lot more death than God,â€ Panyshenko added. On the horizon, plumes of dark smoke rose up into the blue sky, as the sound of artillery and heavy explosions carried across to the house, not far away. 0 Comments [cancel reply](/news/world/ukraines-soldiers-mark-easter-on-the-front-line/#respond) You must be logged in to post a comment. Get the latest news delivered straight to your inbox every day of the week. Stay informed with the Guardianâ€™s leading coverage of Nigerian and world news, business, technology and sports.

author: @ValleyNewsLive
title: Fargo Memorial Guard, FM Legion Riders clean up Fargo National Cemetery despite blizzardy conditions
text: Fargo Memorial Guard, FM Legion Riders clean up Fargo National Cemetery despite blizzardy conditions FARGO, N.D. (Valley News Live) - With the Christmas season having passed by, it was time to clean up the wreaths at Fargo National Cemetery, even if it meant collecting them on a blustery January morning. Members from the Fargo Memorial Guard and the FM Legion Riders spent part of their Saturday morning clearing the cemetery. The group of 50 spent around 20 minutes removing the wreaths that were placed on the grave sites as part of the annual â€œWreaths Across America.â€ â€œI think normally on a nicer day, of course, weâ€™d have a huge turnout, but we still have a lot of people still coming, so weâ€™ll still get it done in a short time,â€ FM Legion Riders Assistant Director Marc Simonet said. The conditions made it difficult for some to make the journey out to the cemetery, with blowing snow and wind chills in the negatives impacting the region. The conditions made visibility low and whiteout conditions made it difficult to drive out to the rural cemetery. Despite the conditions, those that did show up were in good spirit. Jason Hicks, commander of the Fargo Memorial Guard, said that braving the weather was a great way to show respect to veterans. â€œWe had marines that fought at the frozen Chosin Reservoir in conditions just like this. Weâ€™re out here picking up wreaths, weâ€™re not in combat â€“ weâ€™re picking up wreaths â€“ but thatâ€™s why we do what we do,â€ he said. Both Simonet and Hicks were thankful for those that did show up to help out today. To them, the event was a positive opportunity to give back to the cemetery and support veterans and their families. â€œYou look at a day like today, and it just really gives us thanks that we have such a dedicated community out here and that weâ€™re out here in all conditions, all kinds of weather and this just proves it â€“ we have good people to help us,â€ Hicks said. author: The Borneo Post - News
title: Malaysia will achieve greater success under Sultan Ibrahim, Anwar's leadership, says Xi | Nestia
text: PUTRAJAYA (April 16): Chinese President Xi Jinping today expressed confidence that Malaysia will achieve greater success under the leadership of His Majesty Sultan Ibrahim and Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.â€œDuring my last visit in 2013, I was deeply impressed by Malaysiaâ€™s beautiful nature, diverse culture and kind people. Now, coming back 12 years later, I am truly delighted to see Malaysia booming and making great strides in modernisation.
